captions.text: HONEST TRAILER : DARK KNIGHT RISES

NARRATOR
From director Christopher Nolan,

NARRATOR (CONT’D)
Comes the obligatory finale to his Dark Knight
Trilogy…

NARRATOR (CONT’D)
That clearly peaked with the Joker.

NARRATOR (CONT’D)
The Dark Knight Rises…

NARRATOR (CONT’D)
The epic final chapter that will mildly entertain
you when you’re watching it…

NARRATOR (CONT’D)
But will ultimately anger and disappoint you
when you really start to think about it.

NARRATOR (CONT’D)
Revisit the iconic Bruce Wayne…

NARRATOR (CONT’D)
A man who turned the pain of his parents death
into a Superhero.

NARRATOR (CONT’D)
But for some reason, mopes around for eight
years after his sort-of-girlfriend dies

NARRATOR (CONT’D)
Suit up, as he spends the first 45 minutes…

NARRATOR (CONT’D)
Hobbling around on canes…

NARRATOR (CONT’D)
Getting knocked over easily…

NARRATOR (CONT’D)
Growing a gross depression beard…

NARRATOR (CONT’D)
And be told that his body is in complete shambles…

NARRATOR (CONT’D)
Even though in the entire trilogy…

NARRATOR (CONT’D)
He has only clocked in maybe a year and a
half as the Batman.

NARRATOR (CONT’D)
But chaos will arrive in the form of BANE…

NARRATOR (CONT’D)
A villain who no one can fully understand.

BANE
“?Days has casty ya strength?”

BANE (CONT’D)
“Where I learn the truth about despair”

BANE (CONT’D)
“The bat never ‘scaped”

BANE (CONT’D)
“I bon your schedule captain.”

NARRATOR
Prompting mope-man

NARRATOR (CONT’D)
To un-retire and plop on a magic knee brace
that will instantly cure him.

NARRATOR (CONT’D)
So he can take Bane head-on for a few minutes…

NARRATOR (CONT’D)
Until he’s crippled again…

NARRATOR (CONT’D)
For a huge chunk of the movie

NARRATOR (CONT’D)
Leaving this mumbling warlord…

NARRATOR (CONT’D)
To fulfill his overly-complicated plot…

NARRATOR (CONT’D)
Of terrorizing Gotham for 3 pointless months…

NARRATOR (CONT’D)
Which prompts only one riot and no gridlock…

NARRATOR (CONT’D)
Seriously, where is everybody?

NARRATOR (CONT’D)
Get ready for a nearly 3 hour Batman movie.

NARRATOR (CONT’D)
Where Batman only shows up for about 33 minutes…

NARRATOR (CONT’D)
And when he does show up, He’s so terrible
he…

NARRATOR (CONT’D)
Reveals his secret identity to complete strangers.

JOSEPH
“When you started, why the mask?”

BRUCE
“Protect the people closest to me.”

NARRATOR
Never conducts background checks on his maids…

NARRATOR (CONT’D)
Or his board members…

NARRATOR (CONT’D)
Uses ineffective gadgets…

NARRATOR (CONT’D)
Stands atop random buildings that are way
too dangerous to balance on…

NARRATOR (CONT’D)
And wastes several hours painting a bridge
in gasoline.

NARRATOR (CONT’D)
A story so large in scale that it was partly
shot in IMAX…

NARRATOR (CONT’D)
Which becomes super-distracting…

NARRATOR (CONT’D)
When it’s constantly changing aspect ratios.

NARRATOR (CONT’D)
And a film so poorly paced…

NARRATOR (CONT’D)
It moves slow for 2 hours…

NARRATOR (CONT’D)
Then it randomly zooms through 3 months of
time without telling the audience …

NARRATOR (CONT’D)
Forcing this completely rushed ending that
will leave you asking questions like…

RED LETTER MEDIA
Why are the criminals constantly hitting Batman
with their guns instead of shooting him?

RED LETTER MEDIA (CONT’D)
Why would the CIA let masked men on to their
plane without checking who they were first.

RED LETTER MEDIA (CONT’D)
How did Bane know about the existence and

exact location of Batmans secret armory? Especially
after Luscious said it was off the books.

NARRATOR
And why has no one stumbled upon his huge-ass
airplane?

RED LETTER MEDIA
How did Bane and his henchmen hide motorcycles
inside the stock exchange?

RED LETTER MEDIA (CONT’D)
How is it possible that Bruce Wayne completely

healed his broken back in less than 3 months?
Didn’t he need a…doctor?

NARRATOR
How did Batman get from the hole in the middle

of nowhere into the quarantined Gotham money
or equipment?

RED LETTER MEDIA
Why would they send the entire Gotham City

Police Force into the sewers all at the exact
same time?

RED LETTER MEDIA (CONT’D)
If Tamalore knew he was Batman, why did she
let him wander off with Luscious?

RED LETTER MEDIA (CONT’D)
Why didn’t she just kill him when she had
the chance?

RED LETTER MEDIA (CONT’D)
In fact, why didn’t she just detonate the
bomb right then?

NARRATOR
And why does Batman talk to Catwoman in his
Batman voice when she knows he’s Bruce Wayne?

RED LETTER MEDIA
How come everybody in Gotham could figure

out that Bruce Wayne was Batman. except for
Commissioner Gordon?

RED LETTER MEDIA (CONT’D)
Even the character with down syndrome, played
by Joseph Gordon Levitt, figured it out.

RED LETTER MEDIA (CONT’D)
Why did Bruce Wayne show up in a French Café
after being pronounced dead?

RED LETTER MEDIA (CONT’D)
Think that would have attracted the attention
of the media.

NARRATOR
How did Batman eject and swim nine miles to
survive if he only had 5 seconds on the bomb?

RED LETTER MEDIA
Didn’t anyone in Gotham think it was weird

that Batman and Bruce Wayne both died on the
exact same day?

RED LETTER MEDIA (CONT’D)
Bruce Wayne was Batman!?

NARRATOR (CONT’D)
Ugh, I’m pretty weird about Man of Steel
now.

NARRATOR (CONT’D)
Thanks to Red Letter Media, be sure to check
them out.

NARRATOR (CONT’D)
Also check out our latest Screen Junkies Episode

where we play actual fantasy football with
Paul Scheer.

title: Honest Trailers - The Dark Knight Rises (Feat. RedLetterMedia)

comments.author: JackDaniels

comments.text:
Reply to Screen Junkies' questions:
Batman’s suit is made from Nome survival suit for advanced infantry, kevlar 
biweave, reinforced joints is able to withstand gunfire acquired from the 
Applied sciences department in Batman Begins when Bruce explained that he 
needed it for “Spelunking” 

The CIA team was extracting Dr.Pavel, the 3 men were thought to be 
mercenaries working for Bane and the CIA planned to interrogate them on the 
plane for possible intel 

Bane knew about the existence of the secret armoury as Bruce gave Miranda 
Tate(Talia Al Ghul) control of the Wayne Enterprises fearing that the 
fusion reactor might fall in the wrong hands, however, tate is later 
revealed to be working with bane… Spoilers!

The plane was never discovered as Bane had already defeated Batman… nobody 
was actively looking for him much less his stealthy plane designed to go 
undetected 

The motorcycles are getaway vehicles… at this point I feel like screen 
junkies is just cheery picking...

Bruce wayne healed his back with the help of the ex-prison doctor/ morphine 
addict incarcerated there by bane

Batman once trained under the League of Shadows, a group of assassins, 
which grants him stealthy abilities explaining how he reentered gotham, if 
he can’t even do that there’s really no point in calling him batman…

After Bane kidnapped the Wayne Enterprises’s board taking Fox and Tate into 
the sewers, they decide to send in all police officers under the guise of a 
training exercise to prevent Bane from doing whatever he has planned but it 
was too late

Bane’s goal was not to kill Batman, it was to encourage anarchy and to 
destroy gotham…“It’s about sending a message”

Batman continued to use his voice with catwoman because… his voice is 
fucking awesome who doesn’t like it…

Bruce Wayne did not reveal his identity to Blake… John Blake(Levitt) went 
to Bruce Wayne after Gordon’s attack and the discovery of the underground 
army, Blake enlists the help of Batman thus revealing him knowing Bruce 
wayne’s true identity… greatly impressed Batman offers Blake to join his 
vigilante efforts thus becoming ‘Robin’

Bruce’s appearance in the cafe is a symbolic gesture to Alfred, signalling 
that he has moved on from being batman as Alfred had wished

At the end of the film it was revealed the auto pilot patch was fixed 6 
months prior to the detonation, meaning that the plane was auto piloted and 
that Batman was nowhere near the blast when it detonated

The ‘death’ of bruce wayne is only known to Alfred, Gordon, Fox and Blake 
whom were the only ones present in the funeral of Bruce Wayne at the end of 
the film﻿
comments.author: Midget Fok

comments.text:
+Midget Fok The suit would still not protect him for a nuclear explosion. I 
would take 2 seconds to take their hoods off and check who they are. They 
didn't in the movie simply for plot convince. It is medically impossible to 
completely heal a broken back in three moths with or without professional 
medical care. You can assume whatever you want how he got back into Gotham 
but it s never explained in the film. They could have written in an 
explanation and that would have fixed the problem but hey completely gloss 
over how he got in. They would never send EVERY SINGLE cop down in the 
sewer. They would only send in 1 or 2 swat teams. Their is no point in 
sending in an army of thousand of cops. Again, they just did that to be 
convenient for the script. Symbolic gesture? You're looking too much into 
it. It was just to show he was alive. There was no symbolism. Even with 
auto pilot, a nuclear blast cover a radius of many miles with seconds. You 
would have to be superman to escape it. Please do YOUR research before you 
defend obvious flaws in a film.

comments.text:
Clearly Nolan doesn't believe in Gravity as it would cause the petrol to 
drip al the way down the bridge causing to just look like a bridge on fire 
rather than a fire bat symbol on bridge. Also Bane completely destroyed all 
but one of the bridges in Gotham so how the hell would Batman have been 
able to get from Uzbekistan or some place like that to Gotham. And as well 
Bane would have loaded the tunnels under the river with explosives as well 
causing them to flood, so Batman wouldn't be able to get in through them 
either. And Batcopter flying thing was in Gotham the entire time he was in 
the pit. And I really doubt the Army people would've let Batman back in and 
then for him to get through Bane's men on the other side. Another thing how 
the fuck did he get up there? He can't of gone up on one of long metal 
things because it would be to slippery, perhaps damaged, he had his cape to 
drag about. And then where did he get the petrol from in the first place? 
And what was that even meant to say to people other than, 
'Hay Bane I'm here you can break my back again,'?﻿

comments.author: SJMJ91

comments.text:
I reckon Batman DID die at the end of this film. If you think about it, it 
makes more sense. In the early stages of the film, Alfred talked about the 
fantasy of seeing Bruce in Florence with a wife and kids (and the final 
scene could still be a fantasy because how could he start a relationship 
with Selina Kyle after she'd done what she did to him?). There's no way 
Batman would've survived in avoiding a nuclear bomb if he had 5 seconds on 
it before exploding. The grave, statue of Batman and potential funeral 
seemed realistic enough, too, and Blake/Robin inherited Bruce's Bat Cave. 
I'd like to think that he did actually die, although Nolan leaves it open 
for debate and it opens a new Batman for what we're going to see in Batman 
Vs Superman: Dawn Of Justice next year.﻿
